sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Grain</radical>s look like they're on <radical>fire</radical> in <kanji>autumn</kanji>. They all turn red and orange and brown, the colors of fire. It's also fun to set grains on fire in Autumn, since it's getting colder.
meaningInfo: Picture all the grains in autumn. Picture all of the colors. The colors of fire.
readingMnemonic: As the grains burn, and the season changes to autumn, imagine them yelling out in pain: "<reading>ACK</reading> (<ja>あき</ja>)!"
readingInfo:
Ah yes, the sound of the seasons changing to autumn.

Ack!
Ack!
Ack!
